hook.text: She reported the abuse. The university covered it up. The institution she trusted betrayed her worse than the abuser.

buildup.text: Institutional betrayal occurs when organizations that are supposed to protect people instead harm or abandon them.

discovery.text: Research shows institutional betrayal causes worse PTSD symptoms than the original harm in many cases.

twist.text: Cover-ups, victim-blaming, and inaction are forms of betrayal. The institution's silence is a second assault.

climax.text: We trust institutions to be fair. When they fail, they don't just hurt one person â€” they damage faith in all systems.

punchline.text: Institutional betrayal often wounds deeper than the original harm.

quiz.question: What is institutional betrayal?
options: When protective organizations harm or abandon those they should protect
